title: Okamura Family Oral History Interview Video 1
description: Video interview of a Japanese-American couple. The couple talks about their childhood, family life, farming, and life during World War II. title: Okamura Family Oral History Interview Video 3
description: Video interview of a Japanese-American couple. The couple talks about their childhood, family life, farming, and life during World War II. The wife talks abou the generational differences between Issei and Nisei.

title: Okamura Family Oral History Interview Video 4
description: Video interview of a Japanese-American couple. The woman talks about generational differences between Issei and Nisei, the JACL (Japanese American Citizens League), and the Pocatello community. title: Suenaga Family Oral History Interview Video 1
description: Video interview of a Japanese-American family in their home. The family talks about their family life and values, life in Idaho as Asian-Americans, coincidentally avoiding Pearl Harbor, the internment camps during World War II, and immigration from Hawaii and Japan. This video segment consists mainly of the father of the family.

title: Suenaga Family Oral History Interview Video 2
description: Video interview of a Japanese-American family in their home. The family talks about their experiences during and after World War II, and life in Idaho as Asian-Americans. This video segment of the interview includes the wife and the husband's courtship story. There are some stories of racial discrimination. The husband talks about how the United States government assumed he was a Japanese government spy.

title: Suenaga Family Oral History Interview Video 3
description: Video interview of a Japanese-American family in their home. The family discusses their recreational activities, racial discrimination, the community of Pocatello, and the differences that they see from before and after World War II. The wife talks about her family's background, her dancing career in Hollywood and Idaho, her childhood, and her personal life. Their son talked about his family life and upbringing, his experiences as an Asian-American in Idaho, and adulthood.

title: Suenaga Family Oral History Interview Video 5
description: Video interview of a Japanese-American family in their home. The family talks about their life as Japanese-Americans in Pocatello, their family lives, and what it means to be Japanese-American. The youngest members of the family, the grandchildren, talk about what they do in school and at home. The children talk about their karate and dancing activities. The video footage also contains images, photographs, and art in the family's home.
